review: It was more of a 2.5, but I'll be nice today.  This location switched to the new menu once the new year started; my family and I have been avoiding this location for that very reason (Hello?!!!  This girl needs her Pan-Sauteed Salmon with Spaghettini in Lemon Caper Sauce.).  Yet today, for reasons unknown, my mom and I found ourselves in the very location that took away our one true fishy-and-lemon-zesty love. The food was okay.  Half-sized portions of the salads were very generous, and the pasta was decent.  However, my little gripe about today's visit was our waiter--Luis.  He was not very attentive.  He didn't offer us any refills until the end... when he handed us our bill.  -___- Didn't ask us if we wanted dessert.  I asked for Parmesan cheese right when he brought out our food, but somehow I didn't get it until 10 minutes late... He was nice when we he first greeted and seated us, but that quickly dissipated.  He just seemed to be off in his own lala-land.  It wasn't awful service, but it was enough to annoy me to want to Yelp about it. More than likely, I'll be hitting up my regular CPK in Brea before going back to the West Co. location.

I came here with my bf and his little sister for her birthday. She has never gone to CPK and she really wanted to try it so I persuaded my bf to let us go. Once we walked in we were greeted and seated right away. It was a rainy day so there wasn't many people there.  What we got: Chipotle Chicken Pizza($12): I was deciding between the thai chicken pizza and the chiptole chicken pizza, but I've already tried the thai chicken so I decided to go with the chipotle chicken this time. I was glad I got it! It was delicious, but I wish it didn't have beans in the salsa...But anyways...I gave a slice to my bf and to his little sister and they both thought it was pretty good as well.  Pesto Chicken Pizza($13): it was good, but I didn't think it was as good as the chipotle chicken.  Kung Pao Spaghetti($13): his little sister let the both of us try some and I was surprised that it tasted pretty good. It had that kung pao taste. Our server was very attentive as well. My bf and his sister drank a lot of water and there cup was never empty. So yay for the good service and food!

I love CPK. They have great salads and pizzas. Pretty much had all of their salads and I have to say I am impressed how good they are. Both presentation and flavors are always spot on. The pizzas are very good too for a chain place. The wild mushroom one is on the top of my list (make sure to add truffle oil). Overall I love going to CPK.
best customer service & great bartending skills ..... love the citrus adobo margarita  ask for will he is great.

This place is sweet but come sunday they close their doors. Building being knocked down for additional roads for buses. This is grade A crap. Just when I find a bad a$$ place to eat they want to knock it down.

I came during father's day (forgot it was fathers day) my party was a party of 15 and we waited about 1 hr to be accommodated. Not only that but by the time we were seated there were not many customers, so the waiter took time to get our drinks. The food and drinks are great, service is a little slow. If they pick it up this will be a 4 star.

I got the BBQ chicken pizza and tried their fettucini alfredo. Both were absolutely delicious. Our server was prompt, filled up my friend's drink quickly as he had a spicy dish, and was accommodating to a small child we had with us as well. (Thanks, Gio!) BOTTOM LINE: It was a nice, casual dinner. Definitely one of the best CPKs I've been to.

this is my place to go on a Friday night. Me and my best friend have been going for a couple months now. its so bad they know us by name and have our seats saved. We didn't even have to order, they already knew! food is delicious. when i fist was going it was peperoni pizza and these macaroni things that are BOMB...but also extremely against my diet hahaha! so then i tried the grilled chick Caesar sandwich is even better! and one night i was confused on what to order and my favorite waiter suggested the avacado egg rolls ( and i looked confused like i had never had them before my friend said you have had them at Bj's ) so i ordered them.......and wow just wow! so now i am hooked!  & when i was drinking, their drink were delicious and strong. Great friendly staff! one of the managers is the best! especially on my birthday :D

Came in on a Saturday, it was kinda busy, but our server was so great!! His name was Gabe and he was sooooo helpful. We had the tequila fettuccine and the BBQ chicken pizza, both great, but our service was the best. Honestly the best service I've had in a while. He was so helpful and brought out refills without us having to ask. He was so nice too, it was refreshing!!! I love this CPK!

50 % of the time that I come here I receive really horrible service and the other half of the time, I receive OK service.  We all know that the food here is great, but it's just a matter of how your treated that will make you want to come back or not. I'm almost tempted to put 1 star because of the last time I was here, but I 'll add another for the times that I did receive good service. It was a Wednesday night, not busy at all, and our server paid little to no attention to us. And whenever she DID some, she had a fake smile that she tried so hard to keep up whenever she came to our table. Granted I did come here for a business meeting and we had papers on our table, but that does not mean we do not want to be served. It took forever to get our order in and it took forever to get our food. We ordered a pizza and a salad. Shouldn't be too difficult right? I noticed the manager going around to other tables to ask how they were doing but not once did he stop by ours. Did we really look that busy? Anyways, I could've done without this horrible experience here, but with that in mind, I'll be a little more cautious of my choice in restaurant before I decide I'd like a good salad again.

What happened? Where did you go? CPK has always been a big name in Los Angeles. I use to love their BBQ chicken pizza. But recently the pizza has not been doing it for me.  I did love the appetizer, I got the avocado rolls, filled with chicken, bacon, and creamy sauce. Winner!!  Service was ok but the place is really slowly withering away. Time to step it up, CPK!

I love the BBQ chicken pizza, its always good and never lets down! Service is always great (thanks to Courtney!) One drawback is that u have to ask for the bread that use to just be given to u but its  not so bad that it'll ever prevent me from going back! Love CPK!

We got a seat in the back and ordered a appetizer, Hummus with pita bread. That was very delicious. I wish we could have had a larger plate of more hummus. Well, you look at the attached photos under restaurant photos and you decide???       That Jamaican jerk was great.....that's the name of a very delicious spicey pizza....yuummeee.       And look at those pictures of our yuummeee desserts, They were just super great for us fat people.  Fudge brownies with ice cream on top.   Oooh my, I want more.
The food was OK nothing special. The one complaint is that they need to wash the dishes better. The bread plates we got still had stuff from the last customers gross.
I love this place! Love the pizza! Love everything! I can always eat CPK. I enjoy the pan-seared salmon with veggies or I might have a pizza, any pizza will do!
1st time eating here! Our waiter Omar was not very attentive - the food was excellent! We got the Cobb salad and a pizza w/ the works! The price wasn't too bad either!

Ate here for lunch yesterday and had the bbq chicken pizza. It was really good and I was surprised I ate the whole thing! The bread they give you with the vinaigrette sauce is really good too. Our waitress was on top of her game. Right when my drink was running low, she had a fresh one out for me. Sad to hear this cpk is closing down for freeway construction
Great service. Omar was our waiter and convinced us to get dessert (rare for my wife and I). It was pretty busy and we didn't have to wait long for our drinks and food.

You know what? CPK isn't so bad when you have a coupon. :D So right now, they're handing out those coupons at the end of your meal where a manager has to open it up in front of you on your next visit. We were there again on Saturday afternoon to redeem yet another coupon. We got the pear and gorgonzola pizza. It's got caramalized pears and fontina cheese, and they scoop a bunch of salad on top of the pizza with lots of gorgonzola. It's pretty good. It's like a 2 for 1 since we ate the salad on top first, followed by the pizza.  My brother ordered the miso seafood salad. It was the best part of the meal! It didn't sound too appetizing, but it was freaking delicious. There were large chunks of avocado, lots of edamame, daikon, cilantro, and crab. I could have done without the shrimp, but still. It's a really refreshing salad. We got a full order, but the 3 of us weren't able to finish it all. It's a bit pricey at around $15, I think. I suggest getting a half order instead.

I give three stars for the service. Our waitress was friendly and on top of the refills. I give one star for food and cleanliness. The table was dirty as well as the bread plates. My pizza was soggy and my daughters spaghetti and bolognese (?) sauce was very oily.  The place was better when it first opened.

This location I found out changed their menu for the worst.  They removed some of their best dishes (i.e. sauteed slamon with grilled asperagus and delicious lemon caper spaghettini, and the awsome baby clams spaghetti plus others) and surely because they are focusing exclusively on economics without regards to clients.  I was told that fortunatelly not all CPK's changed their menu only those that are franchises, so I have to travel further to CPK Brea, but it will be well worth it.

I came here on a saturday night and i was surprised that it wasn't as full as i thought it would be.  My friends and  I waited about 5 minutes until we got seated. I ordered the mushroom pizza with chicken which came out to about $14 and it was pretty good.  The ingredients were fresh and the chicken was very flavorful and tasty.  The mushrooms were incredible.  My friends ordered the lettuce wrap and the other ordered a salad and they both also looked pretty good. The service was great as well.  The waiter kept coming back to our table to refill our drinks and to ask if we needed anything.  Our food came out fairly quickly and still tasted good.  The price is reasonable and the location isnt to far from my house
BBQ chicken salad is delicious.  I always love coming here all the food is good and the atmosphere is very nice
When we ordered a pepperoni pizza we expected it to be at least a great size. But it was so small, I was upset.  If u get pizza don't share it, unless u don't have a big appetite
PROs: -Outside Seating -Nice Decor -OK service (If you want great service ask for JB!) -Atmosphere -Food is mediocre CON: -Parking is difficult (mall parking)

hmm .. im a fan of cpk but the day that i went both mine and my friends pasta was extremely undercooked. i also asked for my pasta to be extra saucey because often the tequila fettucine comes out dry but it was still dry so i had to ask my server for extra sauce. the service was very good. my server refilled our drinks promptly and she also was very cheerful which made the experience much better.

This is an amazing place to eat lunch on their outside covered patio on a nice day. The chicken piccata is so tender and tasty and the white bean humus with flat bread is incredible. The best sandwich is the chicken caesar on garlic cheese focaccia bread. I always get top notch service from the staff at this location in West Covina which makes this my favorite CPK in Southern California.

I don't know why I keep going back...  It's probably because the food is good...when they actually get your order right!  I've done "curb side" pick up 2 times and both times I've had issues! The first time, I realized they forgot my salad once I got home. rrr!  The second time, I was told my order would be ready in 10 minutes. I arrived in exactly 10 minutes and was told my order was almost ready. 10 minutes later and they still did not have my order ready! The most puzzling part is that I had only ordered a salad! My third experience: I bought a $25 gift card for my mom. When she tried to use it a few weeks later, she was told there was no $ on that card, they could not do anything about it, and she had to call a 1-800 number to see if they could help her. RRR!
My favorite location. ..it's closing today...we had our last lunch this afternoon. ..April is the best. .so sad . But they promised they will open close by soon.
Pretty much your basic CPK.....nothing different to expect. I do deduct stars for slow service however.
Try the habanero carnitas pizza with the salsa in the side. It's very good.

So glad that they are vegan friendly!  Not that there are a lot of choices but the staff is willing to help find a few great options to try.  Two of my favorites are the quinoa and arugula salad or the grilled vegetable salad

Made my return to CPK on Thursday 6/19/14,arrived around 3:20pm had made an early dinner date with GF being that she works at the mall and was off at 3:30 I had ordered ahead of time.Started with the half order of the Roasted Veggie Salad to share,requested that the Roasted Artichoke+Spinach Thin Crust be prepared at 3:35 that way GF would arrive and the pizza would be warm. Manny was a class act,very attentive always had me a fresh Mango Tea ready.Around 4pm Manny comes by sees the pizza and I sitting there and no GF. Manny asked to put the pizza in the warmer,sure I say.Still no GF or phone call,4:10pm GF phone call,still working lost track of time,Praise God.Manny brings me my 3rd Mango Tea and order GF's Mango Tea.The female manager stops by and says oh no let us prepare a fresh pizza.GF arrives and everything is Blessed!If I could give 10 stars I would, CPK's staff,female manager,and Manny.... Thank You all. The food,service,and Strawberry Shortcake the Best,God's Blessings to you all.See you next week.

The quality of the food here is generally good.  I usually get their jambalaya which has crawfish and shrimp in it, pretty tasty.  Pizzas are usually pretty good too and the servers are good at refilling drinks. However, it gets pretty expensive for lunch without coupons, I think like $2.49 for soda.  Almost makes you want to get a beer instead!

We tried the new roasted vegetable salad w/chicken! So tasty with the roasted corn and asparagus. The service at this CPK was spectacular and should be a model for all restaurants. I also appreciate that most CPK managers come to your table and check-in on your experience. It's a nice touch!

Besides that isolated incident I talked about below, I've continued to receive good service from this location. They are super nice, friendly, and the food has been very good. Again, I still have to stress their red velvet cake. It's delish! It's a must!!
Food was great, I like the pizza and the caramelize peach salad. It so delicious. Service was good and it was quiet when we had dinner there.
It's good.  Good enough to come back for your gourmet pizza fix.  The kids like it, so that will guarrantee a return visit.  I recommend the Sicilian pizza.

Didn't bring lunch again and decided again for a healthier choice. so i ordered on-line curbside pickup which was great. i didn't even have to call during my work hours i just clicked the time i needed to pick up my lunch at what i wanted and that was that, i got the CPK Cobb salad which was great. the service was perfect i parked my car at the parking spots of curbside service waited 2mins and BAM they brought my food out to my car. i placed my order on-line around 11:50am and i set pick up time around 1pm. i will be ordering again if i don't bring my lunch it was perfect. plus the salad was good like always CPK has great food from pizza's to salads to sandwich's. Forgot to take a picture but i bet you can tell through my words it was great.

I'm really a pizza lover but for some odd reason, I never tried BBQ chicken pizza. I can say I expected more. My friends rave about this place. They have some crazy selections. I ended going back with my bro and I decided to try the BBQ Chicken again and it was really really good. We know a bartender there so he hooks it up a few times. They have a great selection of bottles. Hmm.. I want pizza now even though I had some last night.  ; ^ D
Do not order curbside.... Waited for a long time to find out that our order was not placed....

Great great customer service! Its a franchise but i love their food. the 1. Food **** =Chicken was good today 2. Hostess ***   3.Location ***** Easy to find. 4.Ambiance **** Cute 5.Service ***** Very helpful 6.Waiting time *** There is a wait.. 7. Likeliness of return **** I need my kung pao chicken lol

3 stars, +1 more for the excellent customer service from Manuel. You already know what you're going to get from CPK when you come here. My gf and I decided to try something different, she went with the Chile blah blah I don't even remember what it's called but I went with the sun dried pasta penne cream thing. The Chile thing was different, but it was good! Something I've never had before. My penne pasta was ok at BEST. Ordered chicken with it ($3 more ok no big deal right? Except, I counted like 7 TINY pieces of chicken. That coupled with a mediocre sized plate of pasta = I'm still hungry). My GF loves the mango/strawberry-iced-teas but our server mixed and matched them to perfection. He frequented our table and was always making sure we were satisfied with everything (I wasn't with the food but his exceptional service was a difference maker). Honestly, I can cook the pastas and the pizzas at home for far less than what CPK charges. However, the service here is fantastic, thanks to Manuel. Real cool, down to earth dude. Hopefully all the other wait staff is just as attentive and caring as he is.  It's been a while since I tipped +30%. Well deserved.

The Bartender here is really nice and made some good drinks. Highly recommend the Waldrof chicken salad and thier Sangria. A little pricey for pizza but overall good if you like thin crust and gluten free options.

I dined here once, but I normally order online and pick-up.... I love having the option of ordering online, it's so convenient! I've never had an issue, there is ample parking, no waiting, my order has been correct, and they even throw in some bread and butter.
I like this CPK over Brea and Arcadia location.  The food here is still greasy and not the best but who can complain
I mean the service is not bad but they could be more friendly! Pasta was dry and I felt like the were rushing me to leave.

I decided to order my favorite pizza and salad to go from the CPK in Covina.  While I was waiting for my food I saw a waitress sneeze in her hands and then put her hands into the container to grab a lemon slice for an iced tea.  She did not wash her hands after she sneezed into them before she grabbed the lemon slice!  I was shocked!  She didn't even care that her hands were full of her germs and she was touching the lemon and then dropping it into the drink.  I was very happy I didn't eat at the restaurant that day.  I have to say though I'm worried about the other waiters and cooks at this restaurant.  They should have a negative star for this!!!!!

I came here on a Sunday afternoon with my family. As we were walking to the restaurant, we noticed that the door looked so cool. It was a revolving door and it makes me feel like I'm in New York! Haha. The place is clean and the décor looks nice. I would say the service is pretty good because our waiter Adrian made sure everything was all right. He also asked us if we needed extra napkins or any other condiments before he brought us our lunch. That's a plus to me! It is more convenient and you don't have to hunt down a waiter whenever you need something CPK has this new thing on their menu called small cravings. My sister got the wedge salad. I thought it was okay but I would get something else like the Mediterranean plate next time. We also ordered the Portobello Mushroom Ravioli, Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, and Chicken Marsala. The chicken tequila fettuccine was so good! I also squeezed lime into my pasta and I like the zesty taste. Yummy! My sister and I also got the red velvet cake for dessert. That was great too! It was perfect and not too sweet.

Did you notice this place has CLOSED.  Not surpised Food was OK    BUT I went to the ladies room and there was only toilet paper  in 1 of 3 stalls.  Each stall had double holders and they were empty except one stall which were almost out.    A lady came in with her son and I told her that there was no paper.  She sent her son into the men's room and told a waitress that the ladies room needed paper.    A couple more ladies came in and when I said there was no TP they just used paper towels. ("Its their own fault if the toilets get stopped up").  I waited took care of business in the stall that had paper, washed my  hands and went out and asked where the paper was?   The waitress just shrugged her shoulder and said they are working on it, didn't seem to care in the least.   I found the manager and asked him if he knew about the situation and he said yes and that the Hostess (Male) at the door was going to bring some in but people kept on coming in.    WHAT ???  The manager was just walking around, do you think he could have stepped in at the front door .....   NO   I guess it was below his level.  Finally I took the paper out of the hostesses hand and gave it to the ladies in the restroom.   They were very appreciative.    If both rolls were out, in 2 almost 3 stalls, when was the last time anyone was in there to check out things   Not only that, but the soap dispenser was running low too.    DISGUSTING!!

Enjoyed the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza. It was pretty yummy. We ended up getting a second pizza to go, I believe it was some meaty one. Dont remember the name, but it was good too. It definately lives up to its name California Pizza Kitchen.

I used to love CPK back in the days.  Haven't been to this food chain for maybe a year or 2.  Their thai salad was the bomb! Now they totally changed the peanut sauce with some weird tasting one.  No bueno.  Plus, the server won't give you bread unless you ask for it where as in back in the days, they used to always serve you bread with butter.  Why? Third, the only good thing about this place are the 3 different kind of rolled tortillas, still the best dish in the whole restaurant.

I will start off with a positive note: roasted veggie salad is always good and California club pizza was alright, nothing special. Now, the negative side: the sever Tiffany was going through the emotion, could've been more friendly. Overall experience, the food is always great but service needs improvement.

I spent my Sunday lunch with my expecting cousin and my sister. Wow, I never order salads when I eat out, but this time, I gave up the pasta and gunned for the salad. I ordered the CPK BBQ Chicken Salad and it was delish! We ordered hummus on the side and I was in heaven. The salad wasn't runny or anything. it wasn't all greens, but there was a light drizzle off bbq sauce (keep in mind I love bbq flavored anything), chicken, beans, sweet corn, and of course cole and lettuce etc. I have never tasted their salads before and I'm in awe. Next time, if it's not pasta, then it's their salads!  I know, I know, CPK...what does the P stand for? PIZZA...my sister ordered their Greek Pizza and, of course, I had a slice of her pizza...also Amazing!

If i could give zero stars i would-the food i ate was good but unfortunately accompanied by horrible service. Waiter forgot to place my order and when he only brought three plates out i asked if there was a fourth entree and was i told I REPEATED THE ORDER FOR YOU..as if it was my fault-he mumbled everything so i couldnt even tell you if he got it right or not but definitely not couteous at all.  Then while serving water he wanted to suddenly be funny  and told me "no water for you" it was inappropriate.  Waiters name is Luis and he should be ashamed of his srvice!!!

Well, It's CPK sooooo....the food is good.  My personal favorite is the Tequila Chicken Pasta.  (I think that's it's name.)  I actually wanted to post a review about this specific location's decor.   It's actually one of the more stylish CPK's I've been to.  Modern looking but much more elegant in design than alot of the other ones.  It feels more like somewhere you could take a date to while wearing a suit.  (Aside from the fact that it's located on the outskirts of the mall.)   Our waiter was friendly and attentive and the food was good as always.  My main purpose for this review was more on the design of this CPK.  It lends to the overall aesthetic and made for one of the more enjoyable experiences for me at a CPK.

Excellent service and consistent food quality.  My favorite is still the Thai chicken pizza.  The iced tea was rather bland.  The waitress was quick to get my orders and served them promptly.  Still a pricey place to eat for a quick lunch for half ceasar salad, Thai chicken pizza, and iced tea costing $24 total.  You are paying for the envrionment too.  :)

pizza was just plain bland, talk about bread and meat only. What happen to the pasta sauce? artichoke dip was decent, drink was meh. The place was nice and clean, if only the food back up the appearance as well. Price was pretty ridiculous as well.

Cocktails are delish.. BBQ chicken pizza is my fav.. Their appetizer menu is tasty and inexpensive.. The only negative thing about this place is the service, they are under staffed and if you need service you literally have to flag someone down.
I must say Rudy our server did an Awesome last night. Vary personable.

Its closing soon!!! I was here on Thursday 7/17 and we were informed they will closing this CPK...they are actually tearing down the whole little area here to make room for the 10 freeway carpool lane..Im really bummed, we love coming here and sit in the bar area..great service, food and atmosphere! Manny the bartender is awesome! I'll miss coming here...anyways i tried the Chile relleno from the lite menu, its really good and filling! Not bad for 400 calories!!!

The night of Valentines which is just another Friday night dinner night for us was I guess a better night than usual. The service and additional selections were a plus. Why can't this be every night?! Early dinner advantage-parking up front, no wait, prime seating. It's still considered Winter but the 89 degree temps made for a comfortable night to dine out in the patio.  We were given the special pre fixe menu and the regular menu. The pre fix was such a deal with an appetizer 2 entrees and a dessert for only $30. Unfortunately, we came in with predetermined options in our head and that was it. Starter was the steamed dumplings that stands great on its own. Can be filling if you eat all of it yourself. I haven't had the tequila lime chicken fettuccine in years. One of my favorite dishes that reminds me of the old and now defunct Crocodile Cafe in Pasadena. I asked to go light on the cream, so my chicken and pasta are not drowning in sauce.  I guess tequila is just part of the name now because I don't taste the tequila just the lime. It's all good though-yummy nonetheless. The chimichurri chicken and vegetables were a welcomed change for the palette. I had to reach with my fork for a taste. Perfectly cooked chicken and grilled veggies were fresh.  The chimichurri sauce was as green as pesto with a slight punch of heat.  Great food and service made for an even greater not so Valentine, Valentines night dinner.

Out of location convenience, we came here on a Sunday morning so we did not check the reviews prior to dining in. There was no wait as mentioned in a few reviews but I do have to say that this establishment is quite dirty. The menus had greasy fingerprints, crumbs on the tables (even though that they had just opened their doors a few moments ago at 11 am), and a dirty restroom.  Used a coupon for a free artichoke dip with $10 minimum purchase. My pizza go to order is always the California Club Pizza with honey wheat dough. Though I normally do not order appetizers but the avocado egg rolls are always awesome!  Price-wise, I still consider CPK's pizzas to be quite expensive for the portion but truthfully, it can be deceiving as well. Even with the size, we were quite full and even had leftovers.  Service was good, nothing extraordinarily special but the server was really attentive. Also registered their new dough card but since I was already using a coupon, I could not redeem my free small plate. The dough card email mentioned that the store would give us an actual card but this location did not, or maybe they did not have it yet. Overall, I would not come back except for location convenience.

The last meal at this location it will soon be knocked down .... It's been fun ..April the manager was amazing extremely friendly always making me feel welcomed I'll miss her service for sure. So long cpk it's been fun .. But I'm moving..

Tried a newer menu option. A quinoa lemon salad. It was huge and tasty. The staff were gracious and kind, as well as really knowledgable of their alcohol offerings. A PLUS!!!  Appetizer of lettuce wraps was very good and quite filling. Pretty decor and pleasant ambience made this A good dinner experience.

Haven't been here in 3 year's. . It's a nice clean roomy restaurant. Delicious cocktails, pizza and pasta. . Nice for a Saturday afternoon meal. I had the sparagus, spinach and shrimp spaghettini, it was delicious. For dessert the chocolate souffle and strawberry shortcake. .

If your coming here, I would recommend you stay away from anything that isn't pizza or pasta! We ordered the focaccia which wasn't very good to start off with and be chicken lettuce wraps were not good either..honestly tastes like the costco chicken lettuce wraps...except I think costcos is better. However my thin crisp artichoke pizza was pretty good. Service was pretty solid as well. Overall good experience but food is mediocre and probably wouldn't come back
Great service. Great pizza. Great vibe.  If you like spicy food order the habenero carnitaa.  Recommendation is to sit at the bar if you want super duper service.

mmm.. 3.3 stars?? Came here a couple nights ago with a friend to catch up over some dinner. We got there at about 830 pm ish. (I ended up eating a little before getting there so I didn't order anything.) It was my friend's first time so I was really excited to have her try some of my favorite dishes... so much for that!! Looks like CPK is undergoing some changes with their menu.. my beloved cranberry walnut chicken salad sandwich is no longer available along with a couple other dishes! ): DEEEVVASSSTATTTIONNNN! boo. Our server, Eric, was very informative, funny, and patient with us. I guess he's been with the company for about five years now? he gave us the whole run down of the menu as to what was more popular and which ones he preferred. I would totalllly hire him I had a restaurant. just saying! Anyways, it took them a while to take our order this time around too ): My friend was STARVING! and it was funny cause we were joking that Eric could've put my friend's baby in danger! (she's prego :D ) but Eric was a really good sport about it. He kept us laughing and smiling the whole time. We ended up ordering the spinach artichoke dip and the california club pizza. Their dip just doesn't seem to come out as hot as I'd like it... everrr. But it was creamy and not too heavy. My friend liked it, lots. The california club pizza looked amazinggggg! I've had it before but I didn't have any this time around since I ate already. It comes topped with avocado, and shredded lettuce. Let's just say I got a thumbs up from m'friend (: yay! The score remains at 3 stars and the only reason why I even bothered mentioning the 0.3 is because of Eric's capability to dissect each and every dish we talked about as well as making us laugh.  It seems that service is one of this location's weak points.. I think I'll stick to the CPK in Arcadia ): sorrryyy!

If you look at all the recent reviews, you'll see that CPK is going down hill. I used to LOVE coming here a few years ago, but this past week's lackluster experience ruined years of being a happy patron for me. First off, the food. The food is what makes up 75% of a rating, and I must say I was sorely disappointed. We tried the spaghetti bolognese (pretty basic, so should be easy right?) and overall the dish was pretty plain. To begin with, there wasn't enough sauce for all of the noodles, but then again the sauce itself didn't have a very strong flavor to it, so I'm not it would have made a huge difference anyway. We also had the wild mushroom pizza. Taste-wise this dish was okay. The most disappointing thing is that the dish was cold. Finally, the nail in the coffin was the service, or lack thereof. Our server was inattentive and though we asked for a refill of lemonade twice, the refill wasn't given to us until after she gave us the check. 2 stars for CPK. If it weren't for the giftcard we used I'd probably be even more irked. We will most likely not be back. Sad sad days.

Follow Up: After waiting a couple of weeks and calling to talk to multiple "managers"; CPK finally credited my account for the missing salad.  So what is the lesson here, THEY F you in the Drive-Thru. So either eat at the location or make sure you double check that you get what you pay for.  As for me, I will take my business else where, the "manager" from the get-go could have handled the situation differently and owned up to their mistake and not treated me as someone who was trying to get a Free salad but a valued client who routinely ate at CPK. Since then, I have taken my business elsewhere.

We waited a long time before a sever came to take our order and waited even longer for our food.  Our food did not come when the customers came later than us had almost finished their food.  We asked a staff to check our order and she pointed at one of the tables and indicated that they were filling a big order.  We turned around and saw the biggest table had 6 people seated (not exactly our idea of a big order).  The food did not come quickly after we had the staff checked on our order (it appeared to us that they had not even start to prepare our orders). When the food finally came, both of what we ordered were prepared wrong.  The sever came multiple times within a very short time frame to check if we were okay with the food after corrections.  We understood that she wanted to make up, but she really was checking on us way too frequently.  She even took away one of our forks along with an empty plate when we were still working on our food. After we got the bill, we left the credit card with the bill and waited for the server to pick up and charge it.  It took such a long time that we did not want to waste our time anymore; we left cash on the table and got out.
Just visited this location and it is closed. Even the signage outside is gone.  Too bad.....

Im not going to write about the food. It is standard fare and some like it some dont.  I want to make a comment specifically about the service. In one word...terrible. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was predictably a slow night. So you would think that the service would be pretty quick, especially with so many servers standing around.  Our server was plain lazy. Every time we asked for something, we politely waited...and waited...and waited some more. On more than one occasion I had to get up and walk over to the server area and make a second request. Overall unacceptable. I know this isn't a gourmet restaurant or anything, but I still expect a minimum level of service.

I came here for lunch with my mom, and I realized that this location was a lot nicer then the Arcadia one. Their place setting was displayed a lot nicer. Our server was very attentive and always checking in on us. We ordered the WALDORF CHICKEN SALAD and the MARGARITA PIZZA, and they were both really good. I think if i decide to come back to CPK I would come back to this location. ENJOY!

Outstanding service!! Peter is such a awesome waiter! Couldn't have had a better service today. Food was great, wasn't that hungry so I ordered the crispy Mac n cheese.. Let me tell you, they look like chicken nuggets lol but taste delicious. Also they are closing this cpk. Bummer!!!!! Thank you Peter for your great service!
Here one day and gone the next.. You will be Missed. Closed for business and it looks like Lucille's is going to be in that area.

This is our local CPK.  Tonight it was more crowded than we had seen in awhile.  We had our regular favorites.  Chinese Chicken salad: this is relatively low in calories for their salads, but it is really high in sodium.  Jamacian Jerk Pizza: great flavor, a teeny bit spicy, yummy dough.  Good quality ingredients and good service made it a great evening.

Was at a catered business lunch in Covina and the food was served by CPK . I tried The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped it comes with Sweet corn, black beans, jicama, cilantro, basil, tortilla strips and Monterey Jack tossed in homemade herb ranch dressing. Topped with BBQ chicken, tomatoes, scallions and Avocado tortilla strips. This is a very tasty salad. I had lemonade as a drink and felt energetic after this meal. If you eat bread you get drowsy after the meal. The bread ferments and produces alcohol in your intestine causing drowsiness. Everyone enjoyed the simple lunch.  It was also a birthday party and a birthday cake was served, to avoid any extra calories nearly everyone avoided this. Americans are becoming health conscious thanks to God.

For being six years since I've been here, the gentleman man that took our order was awesome..! He gave us some tea while we waited for our order. Plus, was patient with me while I took their original pizza and made it the way I wanted.. If you order here to go, ask or look for Will..

ive always been a fan of cpk. how ever i was very sad to see alot of my favorite dishes/pizza were no longer on the menu. bread was available upon request but they were out. the food was just not up to par. our server was really nice which was good. but i dont think i would be going back there any time soon

Great food!  Service is not very good.  This place is close to home and I really enjoy the food.  However the service is very poor.  You get seated fairly quickly, but in most cases I've waited a long time for someone to come and take our order/ serve us.  After that good luck if they ever come back.  Some of the staff is obviously not happy to be there.  Sometimes you get refills sometimes you don't.  You'll get bread if you ask 2 or 3 times.  The food can take extraordinarily long to come out.   These are not isolated incidents this is true almost every time I've gone.  The 2 experiences that have been exceptions involved a server named "Vanessa".  I will still go back and hope that service improves because the food is great and it's close to home.  Remember ask for Vanessa - she's the only one that's been consistently attentive.

I've been here many times and i've never really had a problem up until a few months ago. Happened to be with Sarina W. and we had ordered curbside take out. From reading the info online it seemed pretty convient and we wanted to get some food for our family as well. So we ordered and it was on a holiday so the wait was like 45 to 50 so we understood and we didnt leave the house to pickup till after the time. When we got there we must've waited 20 minutes before someone came out to say something to us. Then it was just one thing after another. Sure we got 2 free drinks, an extra pizza(only because they messed up the first one) and a piece of cake but it was the worst experience in take out i've ever been through.

I'm surprised at how a brand new restaurant could have quality that is below average.  The servers seem to be less alert than most other CPKs'.  We were seated at a very dirty table.  They didn't notice until I made a face after sitting down.  I thought it was just food particles left on the table that they had to wipe off.  But, there were trash left on the seats too.  So, we changed to another booth.  Before I sat down, I noticed the table was dirty also.  Don't they know how to clean the tables anymore?!  Instead of changing to another table, we sat down since we didn't want to wait any longer.  As for the food... it was below CPK's average as well.   Half of our Milan pizza was torched!  The tequilla lime fettuccine was tasteless, no taste what so ever.  While we were eating, I noticed there were trash all over the floor.  The CPK over at Brea Mall is much much better.
best soups, best salads!, all food is great!! try it youll like it!! norma s covina

I would have never gone to CPK if I did not have a gift certificate.  My experience here the last time I went was very poor.  But, in trying to save money, a free dinner or a partially free dinner is always nice.  Me and the fiance decided to be adventurous and order the tandoori chicken pizza and a Waldorf salad.  The pizza was interesting, basically tasted like Indian food on bread, and the salad was tasty.  However, the nice, sweet, polite waiter we had was awfully slow.  It wasn't busy, and I kept seeing him wandering around the restaurant.  For dessert I decided to order the truffle sundae and a coffee drink called an Almond Joy.  We had to wait for about 25 minutes for this stupid sundae, which was so odd because our dinner came out in about 15 minutes.  By the time we got the sundae, the fudge and the caramel had congealed, and the ice cream was melted.  The sundae was still tasty, and I enjoyed my coffee drink.  Then, it took another 15 minutes for the waiter to bring us the check.  For the money, this place is worth it.  The food is ok, but not expensive.  The wait staff needs to be more efficient.  One of the things my fiance noticed when we were eating dinner, was that there were plumbers coming in and out of the men's restroom.  He noted that workers should come in the back, or when the restaurant is empty.  Not so sure I would go here again, unless the wait staff shows a huge improvement.
the bbq chicken pizza is always good but the dessert sucked major balls I got the brownie and why did this crap taste like litlle debbies..

The service is pretty good here.  Food is good. Prices are good.  Good location...so why did I only give it three stars? I don't know...its a cool place great wait staff not packed great alternative to the other resturants!

I've been to this location before and it's always a pleasant experience. Food is always good but the service was what we enjoyed most. I knew I should've posted this review sooner as I forgot our waitresses name. My bad. When it's a weeknight and it's slow, at times the waiters/waitresses become complacent and work up a conversation among fellow employees, a quick "excuse me" will get them off their seats and to your attention. I've read a review somewhere here on yelp that the services here are 50% good. I'm sure it's because of that exact example that I mentioned. I've worked retail before and have found myself engaged in deep conversation at times and am guilty of such that sometimes customers waited till I'm aware that my services was needed. Not all people will ask for assistance. Some are a lil shy or not too voiced-full. But this restaurants staff do a great job.
The spot is conveniently located and the service is great.  They have a great selection of salads and even better free bread.  If u like oil and vinegar, you have to ask for it.

I did a rookie mistake today...............I walked into a restaurant without reading any reviews on it. My lord this place was so far the worst restaurant.......the worst of worst I rather eat in TJ dog tacos than eat at this place. The waiters was 3 1/2 of 5 forget about the service, the food was horrible. I tried their signature pizza, I would of been better off at little ceasers. They exchanged the pizza for a plate called tripled cheese ravioli.........and nothing.............still didn't cut it. Management looked liked they let their employees tell them what to do. No wonder my food took forever. Would not recommend........go spend your hard earned money somewhere else.............damn I forgot my 5 dollar Fiji water.

Baby wanted cheese piiiiii-zza (that's how he says it) for lunch today.  So after we finished our errands at the West Covina mall, we headed for CPK. I ordered a small cheese for baby and the 1/2 chopped salad for myself.  When our food arrived, I took a small bite of baby's pizza to see how hot it was.  It wasn't piping hot, but comfortable enough for him to eat right away.  My salad, as usual, was good. We took a peek at the dessert menu too.  I would have liked to have had either the key lime pie, chocolate souffle cake a la mode, or the red velvet cake...but my stomach wouldn't have it. Service was good and baby finished all his pizza.  This baby momma couldn't ask for more.

Been to this one many times with the family.And what jumps out at me is the decor inside as you walk in.I love the colors they have in their as well as the setup with the bar,the one thing i think it needs is more Tv's.They seem to be on one side of the restaurant. Service seems to be fair.Not bad and not awesome. The pizza which is about 11.50 per pizza...is somewhat feeling..I was still hungry..but then again my mama said i have whats called a high metabolism.Theres other things to choose from besides pizza like salad..but if im going to a steakhouse im not going there to get a salad..im getting   stick to the pizza..they have some awesome selections my fav is called the white pizza.One pizza i did not like is pineapple and ham very tasteless.Try the white pizza. Parking is better now that big boys closed   get thier is a little hasle alot of congestion.But once you get to CPK you will be ok.Enjoy

Never thought I would ever be interested in a grilled veggie sandwich like the one I had at CPK. LOVE IT! The service there though I can live without. Nice place for maybe a casual lunch dinner but nothing to go bonkers over.
My friend got me a RED VELVET for dessert and OMG...it is so delicious.
Great service. The food was delicious! We had Avocado Club Egg Rolls for our appetizer, I had to Portobello Mushroom Ravioli for dinner, and for desert the Red Velvet Cake.

Having been to several CPKs all over the place, any sort of sense of wonder that I'd feel with regard to their unique novelty pizzas has been gradually fading over time. And, it's not because I think the pizzas are bad or anything.  It's mainly because I'm obsessed with one particular pasta dish on their menu: Kung Pao Spaghetti.  It features a classic Kung Pao sauce (of course) with garlic, green onions, peanuts and hot red chilies.  You can have it with chicken and/or shrimp. The Spinach Artichoke Dip served with tortilla chips is always a great starter.  For a place like this, the bread that they serve as complimentary always comes off as surprisingly underwhelming.  A place that does it's own pizza dough and puts out well-executed pasta dishes should be Jedi-status when it comes to all things carbohydrates.   Service has always been attentive during my visits.  The dining room has a pleasant decor, with light linens and dark woods that succeed at making the place feel warm.

Good:Variety of pizza's,decor is up to date. Consistent taste no matter which one you go to.Price is about what you expect to pay for. Bad:Have to drive into the mall complex so having to deal with in/out traffic. It's mediocre pizza, good but nothing 5 star. Service:Service is usually good,don't have to ask server to refill cups, pizza is deliver hot. Rating is A from Public Health.

Great place for a later dinner. This CPK had a nice casual/mellow mood. We hit it just right during the week one night around 8:30. The place was not too busy and we received attentive service from our server. We tried a new pizza on their menu, the Buffalo Chicken with carrots, celery, blue cheese, and you guessed it, lots and lots of Tabasco sauce. It was spicy enough to get the sinuses going, but tempered by the ranch dressing that came on the side. We totally loved it. Will definitely be coming back here again in the near future.

I love CPK.  I have two favorite things I order all the time.  Excellent service.  Everyone from the host to the managers are super friendly.  When my boyfriend and I ordered our meal to-go the host offered us water while we waited for our order.  The only downside is that if you want bread & butter you have to ask your server for it.

This is a place the seems to be confused on plate size and menu size. All the pizzas just seem to have stuff that sound interesting but aren't practical. I can see how someone might want to have something out of the norm but whatever to you, why not just make a good pie. I and my girlfriend walked in on a not so busy thursday we got a table right away. The Expectations were to walk in with one and a half hours to get in and out, even have a beer or two. We waited a good fifteen minutes before one waiter noticed us. He only took our drink order as we waited for our real waiter. She showed put after we got our water and took our food order... it was the chicken pesto pizza. Our party of two then received our beer after our order went out, so i thought we were good on time. The waiters, as i watched them, all seemed to be doing less then they could be doing. One waitress was so backed up she had to bus her own tables, others just watched. Where is the team help? As far as plates go, it looks like when you order pasta they give you enough to eat take home and have a midnight entree. Same with the pies, i like to have pizza but it's about eleven inches, you don't need to eat that much. Bottom line, I don't think anyone should eat too much from out anyway. The only reason I was watching the waiters and other people was because it took close to thirty minutes for our pie which came and didn't look nice at all. It was to have sun-dried tomatoes which were not really there, hardly any basil, but we did get a hair on the crust. From the look of it, it might have been the server who brought it, but when in doubt throw it out. I didn't make a scene or anything, i just pointed to it and she knew right away what to do. Ten minutes later we got a fresh new pizza pie, this one was the one. All the product was there and the pizza even had a darker crust. Looked great, so... why couldn't they do it like that the first time. No manager came to talk to us and I wasn't ready to pay for a mistake and bad service, so we went to the manager. she found it fair to knock off a few bucks. I doubt i'll go back.

Wow, I can't believe I just had the most horrible CPK experience.  Never again, CPK WesCo, never again!   Okay, I can let things slide, if we don't have the greatest service sometimes.  It happens.  The first time my sister and I went to this CPK, she forgot her credit card in the bill fold thingy.  Hours after we'd left the joint, she calls CPK, and asks if they have her credit card.  She didn't explain what it looked like, or anything, they just said, "Yes, we have your credit card."  WTF?   Errrright.  When we went back to go pick it up, she walks in and says, "Hi, I accidentally left my credit card here?"  The hostess just looks into a cubby, and just hands it to her!  No questions asked.  Nothing!  So of course, my sister immediately cancels her credit card, and asks for a new one.  Talk about security!  Thanks a lot, CPK! So then last night, my sister, my mom and I were discussing on what to have for dinner.  My mom says, "CPK!"  Then my sister says, "If we have CPK, I'm not paying, because of last time."  Okay, understandable.  So, my sister, my mom and I went to have dinner @ CPK.  We waited for about 15 minutes.  It's father's day.  Understandable.  We figured, anywhere we went, there would be a wait.  We get seated, and order immediately.  We explain to the server that we not only want drinks, but we're ready to order.  The server explains that they're backed up in the kitchen, so everything's going to take a minute.  My mom asks, "but we'll still get bread, right?"  The server says, "Let me see what I can find."  Wow, that doesn't sound too good.  Is she going to pull  a couple of pieces last week's bread, and put 'em together?   Okay, our order:  me and my mom split a Thai Chicken Pizza.  My sister has the half order of the new seafood miso salad.  After so many refills later...actually 45 (I clocked it, because the server said that things are backed up, so I was curious to see how much they were backed up) minutes later, the pizza comes out.  Server says she wanted to bring out the pizza, because she didn't want it to get cold.  Another 10 minutes after that...my sisters salad finally arrives.  FINALLY, we all get to eat.  OMG...55 minutes for 2 dishes?  Are you kidding me!?!?  When we're done, we're sitting there, waiting for the server to pass by, and we're discussing our food.  My sister explained that the crab in her salad tasted old.  Like it had been sitting out for a couple of days.  She also happened to have some sort of coupon, and hands it to our server.  It's sealed, and it says that someone from CPK is to open it.  So, the server looks at it and says, "Oh, a manager would have to open the coupon, and see what you would be able to receive."  REALLY?!  So...another 15 minutes to wait for the manager.  The server is profusely apologizing for our wait.  We see other parties coming to eat their meal and leaving.  All 3 of us were irritated.  It wasn't the servers fault at all, as she was hustling, and you can see that it was all out of her hands.   The manager finally arrives.  So, of course, she asks how we're doing, and my mom says, "I'm pissed!"  My mom tells her the horrible time that we've had, how long we've been having to wait.  The manager just apologizes, and doesn't do anything more than that, and proceeds to open the coupon.  It turns out our coupon is 50% off.  So my mom says, "Just give us the bill already.  Do what you need to do."  The manager leaves to what I presume is to go find out how much our bill is.  I'm guesstimating $25 (for 2 dishes and drinks).  A couple of minutes later, the manager comes back and says, "You know what?  I'm just going to take care of your bill."  Big whoop.  She's taken care of our $25 bill.  We're like, "okay," and stormed out. So a couple of hours when we got home. remember that crab that my sister was complaining about in her salad?  She broke out into hives that night.  NEVER AGAIN, CPK...NEVER AGAIN!

love that this place is also close to yogurtland! Love this place, wait time usually decent, alot of parking avaiable, outdoor sitting not too bad...but it is by the parking lot so that could be a problem with exhaust and all.  I love the server, Britney. I have not seen her for a while but she is the BEST. So lucky if you have her as she is very attentive and will make sure your food is just perfect or else she will try to get you a replacement.  She was there when they first opened. The interior is a bit dim for some who like brighter lights, but overall it's great place. Expect to spend at least $15 though per person. And that is usually mininimum ;( The "hockey puck" dessert, Chocolate Soufflé Cake, is awesome. Although over the months i find the quality has gone down.  The souffle is more dry, harder, and just not as warmed as before.  The ice cream that goes with it is so wonderful.  Always a perfect ending for our dinner/lunch.

California Pizza Kitchen aka CPK is an extremely consistent eatery.  What I mean by consistent is that the service is slow at all of their restaurants.  Whilst sitting at the bar, it usually takes about 5-7 minutes to get acknowledged by the "bartender" and another 5-7 minutes to get a drink.  After which, you are asked if you would like some food.  Again, the food service is slow.  The pizza isn't dazzling, but it is definitely edible.  If you need a pizza fix, and there isn't anything else around, this is a good bet.  However, if there are any other pizza joints around, go there.

I went here for dinner with my boyfriend. The host didn't seem like he wanted to be there. He was going to seat us near a huge, loud birthday party (maybe 14 people), when there were tons of other empty tables everywhere else. We requested a different, quieter spot, and then sat at the table we picked. We had two different waiters. Our second waiter took his time getting our order in. We ordered something to go, and he placed the order. About fifteen minutes later, I see him folding pizza boxes on the other side of the restaurant. He did this for about 9 minutes. He brought our to-go pizza and it was the wrong pizza we ordered. So we sent it back, and got our correct pizza. If the people who work here were more people-oriented and seemed like they like working there, I think it would be a better place. I think the waiters and hosts don't really care that much about what the customers want! Not going back there. Also, everything is over-priced. $12 for a salad? We got one salad, two pizzas, and one beer. The total was about 60 dollars. You would think that when the food is that expensive, the service would be over the top, really nice. Not here. I'd rather go to Pizza Port in San Diego: 2 beers, 2 pizzas for about 40 bucks.

So my waitress was gorgeous, funny and fabulous (ask for Linda H. she'll take care of you).  The decor is neat, clean, and straight to the point, which I appreciate.  And the food was fun and creative.  I'd never been here, nor had much of an interest, but their crazy pizzas really make pizza fun again.  I didn't try any alcoholic drinks, but the bar looked great.  Prices are decent and you get plenty of food.  Recommendations: I had the California Club.  It was eggggcellent.  Linda also recommends the Carne Asada Pizza and The White Pizza.  I completely dig CPK.
CPK west covina has awesome service!! great food!!

Formerly one of my favorite restaurants to visit in West Covina.  Recently the service and menu items are lacking.  The same staples like Chicken Marsala and Chicken Pesto Pizza that we have enjoyed for years are gone.  Not sure what is up with the Chicken Pesto Pizza leaving as they still show it on the menu and have ALL the ingredients for other dishes.  The curbside (which our office uses 3-4 times per month) ALWAYS has an error.  I do not know if there has been a local management change or if this comes from unfortunate changes at the corporate-level.  Today there were not even bags for our curbside order.  How can we take food home without bags?
